name: Marvel Superheroes Quiz | Marvel Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What caused Bruce Banner to transform into "The Incredible Hulk"?
options: He would just revert without explanation
questions.explanation:
When he would get excited.

	In the first issue of "The Incredible Hulk", (1962) Dr. Bruce Banner saved a teenager from a gamma bomb and moved him to a ditch. He was struck by the effects of the bomb and turned into "The Incredible Hulk",  a green monster with no memory or intelligence of Banner. He was enraged easily and many times would become a menace to society but incredibly, stopped many villians and saved many mishaps from happening.

questions.text: What was the occupation of Tony Stark/"Iron Man"?
questions.explanation:
wealthy businessman.

	Tony Stark was the head of Stark Enterprises, which he inherited from his parents. While checking on one of his plants, which was ambushed, Stark was kidnapped by an evil warlord named Wong Chu. During his captivity, Stark created an iron suit that saved his life and helped him escape. He later improved his armor and used his new powers to save the world. Issue #1. (1963).

questions.text: How did "Thor" get his supernatural powers?
questions.correct: He was given a hammer by his father
options: He was struck by a bolt of lightning
He was in a car crash
He was injured in a lab mishap
questions.explanation:
He was given a hammer by his father.

	"Thor", the "god of thunder", was the son of Odin, lord of the gods of Asgard. He gave Thor this gift along with his powers on his eighth birthday. Thor led many battles and extolled the way of the warrior and reveled in his worship. His archenemy, Loki, was actually his stepbrother who always tried to undermine him.

His shield.

	Steve Rogers was a fine arts student who became a test subject for a top secret defense research project, Operation Rebirth, during World War 2. After being exposed to "Vita-Rays", that activated and stabilized his chemical systems, he recovered his health and gained supernatural powers and extraordinary musculature reflexes. He used his newfound powers to fight off many war enemies. Issue #1. (1941)

questions.text: "Namor Atlantic" was also known as the "Sub-Mariner".
questions.explanation:
True.

	Dubbed the "Prince of the Sea", "Namor Atlantic" had a short temper and an undying hatred for suburban dwellers, who he believed were responsible for destroying Atlantis, an underwater island in which his ancestors were from.Namor is also decsended from the homo mermanus race. Issue #1 (1939).

questions.text: Who was "Iron Man"'s most important foe?
questions.explanation:
Kang the Conqueror.

	Kang kidnapped Tony Stark and brainwashed him into killing fellow superhero Yellowjacket and Marillo, Crystal's nanny. Kang and his followers also created an evil teenage version of Stark and called him Teen Tony. Stark eventually overcame and took control of Kang. Avengers, Issue #129 (1974).

questions.text: What was so special about "Captain America"'s powers and abilities?
questions.correct: His powers never wear off when he reverts to his human identity
options: He  can fly and breathe under water
He instantly gains 200 pounds and then loses it
His fists instantly turn into steel
questions.explanation:
His powers never wear off when he reverts to his human identity.

	"Captain America" can also heal faster than many humans and is immune to many disesaes. He could also dodge many bullets or bombs. He was also known as one of the greatest combat fighters.

questions.text: Why was "The Incredible Hulk"'s identity kept from Betty Ross?
options: His enemies would capture and kill her if they found them together
Hulk was responsible for her father's death
Betty was an undercover agent on a mission to eliminate him
questions.explanation:
She despised the Hulk.

	Banner courted and later married Betty Ross, daughter of his boss, General Thaddeus Ross. Ross was constantly trying to hunt down the Hulk while Betty begrudged the hulk for many past escapades and was always able to elude her father, causing chaos.

Donald Blake.

	Dr. Blake was a brilliant medical surgeon with a reputation for caring and compassion. When he transformed into Thor, however, he had no memory whatsoever of his humble mortality. Issue #1 (1966)

questions.text: What was the name of the superhero group "Namor Atlantic" had founded?
questions.explanation:
Defenders.

	Although Namor belonged to all these groups, he was the creator of the Defenders. Defenders consisted of The Hulk and Dr. Strange, two fellow superheroes to fight the Omegatron, an evil computer that threatened the Earth. They even teamed up with the Silver Surfer on occasion until an evil curse forced the group to go seperate ways and eventually they disbanded. Defenders Issue #2 (1970).
